directions.Direction: Start by preparing the apricots. Stone and halve the fresh apricots. In a pan, melt a small amount of butter over medium heat. Add the apricots and a couple of tablespoons of sugar. Cook until the apricots are soft and have released their juices, forming a syrup.

Preheat your oven to 165°C (350°F). In a large mixing bowl, combine the olive oil and plant milk. Add the sugar and a pinch of salt, mixing until well combined. In a separate bowl, mix the almond flour, plain flour, and baking powder. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until smooth and well combined.

Line a cake tin with baking paper. Pour the cake batter into the prepared tin. Pour the cooked apricots (save a few for garnish) and their syrup evenly over the batter. Sprinkle crushed pecans on top.

Bake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Once baked, serve slices of the apricot cake with reserved apricots in syrup and a dollop of yogurt on the side.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Apricot Cake (plant based)
Description: A delicious moist and slightly tangy cake with seasonal Apricots :)

directions.Direction: Toast basmati rice until fragrant, then add water, soy milk, and soy cream.
Crush the cardamom in a mortar and pestle or with a knife. And then add salt, crushed cardamom pods and seeds into the rice and stir.
Adjust consistency by adding soy milk as needed.
Prepare raisin and nut topping: heat ghee or neutral oil, toast almonds, cashews, and golden raisins; set aside (be careful to not burn them).

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Kheer
Description: A warming and creamy dessert recipe made vegan this Diwali. Eat a spoonful before dinner to taste yummy goodness.

ingredients.Name: A pinch of orange food colour

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, add paneer, mawa, cardamom powder, and wheat flour. Mix everything and roll it into a firm dough.
For the Filling
In another bowl, take some of this dough and add orange food color and driedfruits and mix everything.
In another pot, add sugar, water and saffron and boil it and set aside.
Form a ball from the dough and fill it with dryfruits.
Repeat the process with the rest of the dough and filling. Fry them in hot oil/ghee and dip it in the sugar syrup.
Your mawa baati is now ready. Serve warm. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mawa baati
Description: Rich, sweet and flavorful dish that simply melts in the mouth.

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, add flour, semolina, sesame seeds and coconut.
In a separate pan, melt some jaggery in water. Once done, add the jaggery water into the flour mixture and knead it into a dough and let it rest for a few minutes.
Cut the dough in lemon size balls and roll them flat. Make some designs if you prefer.
Fry the khurmi until its golden brown.
The khurmi is now ready to serve. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Khurmi
Description: My personal favorite Indian sweet.

directions.Direction: In a vessel, add jaggery and water and warm it on low-medium flame until the jaggery dissolves and set it aside.
In a mixing bowl, add flour, fennel seeds, baking soda and the jaggery syrup.
Give everything a good mix until the batter reaches thick and a bit flow consistency.
Meanwhile, heat the oil for frying in a pan and once the oil is hot enough, scoop the batter with a spoon and fry the gulgulle until they are light brown.
Repeat the process for the rest of the batter.
Gulgulle is now ready and can be served warm. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Gulgulle
Description: A perfect harmony of sweetness and crunch.

directions.Direction: Start by preparing the gelatin. In a small bowl, combine six grams of vegetarian gelatin powder with sixty grams of cold water. Let it sit for five to ten minutes to bloom, allowing it to absorb the water and swell.

Next, in a medium saucepan, combine four hundred eighty grams of double cream, two hundred forty grams of whole milk, and one hundred grams of caster sugar. Split one vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Add both the seeds and the pod to the saucepan. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally until the sugar is completely dissolved and the mixture is hot but not boiling. Remove the vanilla pod.

Once the cream mixture is hot and the sugar is dissolved, remove the saucepan from the heat. Add the bloomed gelatin to the hot mixture and whisk until the gelatin is completely dissolved and well incorporated.
For an extra smooth panna cotta, strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large measuring cup or bowl with a spout.
Pour the mixture into a small bowl that you would like to use as a sharing mold. Allow the panna cotta to cool at room temperature for about thirty minutes.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least four hours, or until the panna cotta is set. For best results, chill overnight.

While the panna cotta is chilling, prepare the cherry topping. Take a handful of fresh cherries, remove the stones, and halve them. In a small pan, add the cherries, a couple of tablespoons of sugar, a splash of water, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Fry the cherries over medium heat until they soften and release their juices, forming a syrupy sauce.
Once the panna cotta is set, spoon the cherry topping over the top before serving.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Cherry Panna Cotta
Description: Enjoy a creamy panna cotta with a hint of vanilla, topped with a sweet cherry compote. It's simple to make and perfect for sharing.

directions.Direction: In a pressure cooker, add soaked chana dal, 2 green chillies, turmeric powder, salt to taste and some water. Cook the dal for 15 minutes and set aside.
In a mixing bowl, add flour, salt and water. Knead the dough firm. Set it aside and let rest. Meanwhile, blend the soaked tamarind and strain the juice into a bowl and keep it aside.
Make small-medium sized balls from the dough and roll the ball in a round/oval shape and deep fry into oil until its crispy. Repeat the process and the pakwan is now ready.
In a pan, heat oil, add green whole chillies, chilli powder and some salt. Shallow fry the chillies until they are soft. Leave them aside.
The dal pakwan is ready. Serve the dal hot topped with chopped onions, tamarind juice and coriander along with pakwan and fried green chillies. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dal Pakwan
Description: A crispy canvas for a flavorful splash of dal.

directions.Direction: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F)
Wash the aubergines, poke them all over with a sharp knife, then rub them with oil. Bake in the oven for about 1 hour or until fully soft and cooked through
Once baked, place the aubergines in a bowl and cover with cling film or a lid, allowing them to steam and cool
Peel the aubergines carefully, leaving the stem intact. Gently press them down with a fork to increase their size. Pat them dry on both sides and season with salt and pepper
Dredge the aubergines in flour, then dip them in milk, and coat them in breadcrumbs

Heat sunflower oil in a frying pan and fry the breadcrumb-coated aubergines until golden brown on both sides. About 3 minutes before finishing, add the chopped shallot and sage leaves to flavor the oil
Drain the schnitzels on a paper towel and season with salt
For the Potatoes:
Cut the potatoes into cubes and toss them with oil, salt, and Italian herb mix
Air fry or bake the potatoes at 180°C for 30-35 minutes until golden brown
For the Garlic Butter:
In a small pan, heat the butter and add the sliced garlic. Fry until slightly golden
Add the chilli powder and parsley, stirring well
Serve the aubergine schnitzel with the crispy potatoes on the side, topped with garlic butter. Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges for a bright finish.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aubergine Schnitzel
Description: A delicious vegetarian twist on the classic schnitzel, served with crispy herbed potatoes and a fragrant garlic butter. It's a hearty and satisfying meal with layers of flavor.

directions.Direction: Wash the potatoes and cut them in half. Boil in salted water until fork-tender, then drain and set aside
Peel the aubergines and cut them into similar-sized pieces as the potatoes. Season the aubergine with a little salt and let sit for 10 minutes. Squeeze out the excess water from the aubergine
Finely chop the preserved lemons and mix with rosemary, bay leaves, pul biber, bashed garlic cloves, olive oil, and salt
In a large bowl, add the preserved lemon mixture to the drained potatoes and aubergine, and toss well to coat
Spread the mixture out onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper
Roast at 190°C (375°F) for about 40 minutes or until crispy, stirring occasionally for even cooking
Serve the roasted potatoes and aubergine on top of a layer of thick yogurt, drizzled with more olive oil and sprinkled with sumac

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Roast Potatoes with Aubergine, Preserved Lemon, and Yoghurt
Description: A deliciously tangy and savory dish, combining crispy roasted potatoes and aubergine with the rich flavor of preserved lemons and creamy yogurt.

ingredients.Name: mustard oil, ghee, or sunflower oil
Thumb  sized piece of ginger, grated
Big handful of fresh mint leaves

directions.Direction: Finely slice the onions and mix them with 1 tbsp oil
Place the onions in an air fryer or oven set at 160°C for about 20-25 minutes, stirring every few minutes until crispy
Once done, drain the onions on a paper towel and season with salt
Cut the cauliflower into florets and slice the leaves. Wash in cold water, then cook in boiling salted water seasoned with 1/2 tsp turmeric until just under fork-tender. Drain and set aside
Heat a wok with mustard oil. Once hot, add cumin seeds and hing, followed by 1.5 tbsp grated ginger and green chillies, and immediately reduce the heat to low
Fry for a few seconds, then add turmeric, chilli powder, and coriander powder. Mix well
Add 1/2 cup of water and let it boil until the oil comes to the surface. Add more water if needed
Add the cauliflower and leaves to the wok, season with salt, and mix well. Set aside to cool
For the green chutney, pick the mint leaves off the stems and blend with 1 green chilli, tomato, garlic, the remaining ginger, salt, and lemon juice. Add a little water and blend until smooth
Mix the chutney with the yogurt and adjust salt if needed
Toast the ciabatta and assemble the sandwich by spreading the yogurt sauce, adding the spiced cauliflower, crispy onions, and cucumber slices. Spread more yogurt sauce on the other side of the bread
Serve and enjoy!
This sandwich is a delightful mix of textures and flavors, with the spicy cauliflower, crispy onions, and refreshing yogurt chutney bringing everything together!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Gobi and Crispy Onion Sandwich
Description: A flavorful, spicy sandwich with perfectly spiced cauliflower, crispy onions, and a refreshing mint yogurt sauce, all nestled in toasted ciabatta bread. It’s perfect for a satisfying and hearty meal.

ingredients.Name: potatoes, peeled and boiled. (red potatoes are great)

directions.Direction: Heat the oil in a wok.
Just before it starts to smoke, add the mustard seeds and let them start to pop.
Add the cumin seeds, they should start to crackle.
Then add the hing and curry leaves and stir.
Let the heat come down slightly and add the ginger/garlic. Stir it for 3 seconds then add the onions.
Cook the onions down on a low heat for 5 minutes until soft and slightly golden brown.
Add the chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Stir and cook for a minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the potatoes and cover with water. Bring to a boil then simmer for 15 minutes.
You can use raw potatoes just simmer for 30 minutes and add more water as needed.
Finish with a pinch of salt and fresh coriander.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo Sabzi (Potato Curry)
Description: From Ep.1 of my series How to cook Indian food properly.

directions.Direction: 1. Rinse and drain the chickpeas then mix with onion powder, paprika, oregano and salt. Add a tbsp of olive oil and mix well.
2. Place on a tray lined with baking paper and bake in an oven set at 180 celsius for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
3. Chop the vegetables and also the olives and parsley.
4. Add to a large bowl with the sultanas and crush the walnuts in with your hand.
5. Once the chickpeas have cooled down add them to the bowl and mix well.
6. Keep in the fridge for 3-4 days and serve with lemon, olive oil and salt.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Roasted chickpea salad
Description: A delicious fresh salad with a good serving of protein from the chickpeas. Great for meal prep.

directions.Direction: Sieve the besan into a bowl to remove any lumps.
Mix with the water, yoghurt, chilli powder, turmeric, ginger and salt.
Transfer to a non stick pan and heat on a medium flame. Use a spatula or whisk to keep it moving and prevent sticking.
Keep cooking on a low flame for about 30 minutes.
Then immediately spread out over a board or metal tray that has been lightly oiled.
Let it cool then cut lines to allow you to roll. Sprinkle with the coconut and coriander.
Roll into Khandvi shape rolls and place on a plate.
Heat a small pan and add the oil and allow to come to temperature.
Add the mustard seeds, let them pop then add the sesame seeds, hing, green chillies and curry leaves.
Fry for 20 seconds then spoon over the Khandvi. Enjoy!

ingredients.Name: ajwain seeds, crushed in your hand

directions.Direction: For the baati
Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl with some water to form a dough. Add water slowly as needed.
Let the dough rest for 15 minutes. Then form into balls and bake at 180 celsius for 30 minutes. Finish on an open flame for a few seconds to get a nice char.
Dip them in melted ghee and set aside.
For the Churma
Take one baati and blend into a powder. Add this powder to a pan with some ghee and fry with the cashews, almonds, icing sugar and cardamom powder until golden. Then set aside.
For the dal
Soak all the dal overnight then rinse well. Cook with the turmeric until soft then break up the dal.
For the dal temper
Heat a pot and add 3 tbsp of ghee. Temper the mustard and cumin seeds. Add the hing, green chillies and curry leaves.
Add the garlic, ginger and onion. Fry for a few minutes.
Add the tomato, chilli powder, coriander powder and fry for another minute.
Add the cooked dal with a little water. Add the garam masala and cook for 1 more minute.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh coriander.
All the elements are complete and you can serve :)

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dal baati Churma
Description: The must have Rajasthani delicacy.

ingredients.Name: A thumb of ginger (finely chopped or paste)

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds and pop for a few seconds.
Add chopped potatoes and green chillies and fry until they look golden and crispy.
Add some salt and turmeric powder and let simmer for a few minutes. The aloo bhujia is now ready. Set this aside.
Next, cook the soaked rice. One ready, set them aside. And meanwhile, boil the dal.
In a separate pan, heat some oil and add cumin seeds, hing and dry red chillies and let splatter for a few seconds.
Now add your chopped onions, ginger and garlic and saute until golden brown.
Now, add your chilli powder, and salt. Saute until the oil starts to separate.
Once the oil separates, add the boiled dal and some water to adjust the consistency.
Bring the mixture to boil and the dal is ready. Garnish it with some fresh coriander.
Serve this with warm rice, and aloo bhujia. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dal bhaat and aloo bhujia
Description: The ultimate comfort food.

directions.Direction: Heat some oil in a pan and pop the mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Add the hing, curry leaves and garlic/chilli paste. Fry for a few seconds.
Then add the turmeric and garam masala.
Add the boiled potatoes, coriander, lemon juice and salt. Mix everything together then set aside and leave to cool.
Once cooled form the potato into balls and flatten slightly.
For the batter mix the gram flour into a bowl and mix with water until it forms a thickish batter. Should be pourable.
Crush the ajwain seeds and season with salt.
Coat the potato balls in the batter and fry in hot vegetable oil until golden brown. Drain on a paper towel.
To make the churra, sprinkle some excess batter into the oil and once golden drain on a paper towel.
For the red chutney blend all the ingredients together.
For the green chutney blend or pound in a pestle and mortar.
Build the vada pav by applying the chutneys to the bread rolls then add the vada and enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Vada Pav
Description: I used to make this at my old job as a chef in a hotel. My sous chefs were Indian and I fell in love with the vada pav the first time I tried it.

directions.Direction: Finely slice the onions and add to a bowl with the ginger and green chilli.
Add the coriander leaves, curry leaves, peanuts and sesame seeds.
Add the 3 types of flour and mix well.
Add the ghee, hot oil and a pinch of salt and mix well.
Form into balls, you may need to wet your hands or add a splash of water.
Press the balls onto a square of baking paper and make a flat shape.
Fry in hot oil until golden on both sides then transfer to a plate with a paper towel to drain.
For the chutney you must toast the peanuts with the garlic and chilli for 2 minutes in a dry pan. Then add a little oil at the end.
Transfer to a blender and blend with a little water and salt. Transfer to a serving bowl.
For the temper heat the oil and temper the mustard seeds, urid dal and chana dal. Let them go slightly golden.
Add the curry leaves then pour the oil over the chutney. ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Maddur vada and peanut chutney
Description: Classic street food snack from the city of Maddur

directions.Direction: If you are using a whole tamarind block, soak it in some hot water before you soak your daal.

First, rinse your toor dal in water before adding water to cover and inch above the dal, tomatoes, turmeric, red chilli powder, and ginger. Give that a good mix before cooking it on medium heat in a pot.
Once cooked, use a mortar and pestle to mash the dal.
Next, add coriander to the mixture before straining your soaked tamarind block. Once you have your tamarind liquid, add that back to the dal with your desired amount of salt.
Place your pot or pan back on the stove and whisk the dal to mix evenly.
In another pot or pan, add your neutral oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilli, green chilli, garlic, red chilli powder, and curry leaves. Temper these spices until they are fragrant.
Once the mustard seeds pop, pour the hot liquid and the spices into the pot with your dal. Stir the mixture before adding in your chopped coriander.
Serve with rice and raita for a perfect meal!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Hyderabadi khatti dal
Description: A classic dish that warms the soul when eaten on a cold evening. Nothing says comfort like this Khatti Dal.

ingredients.Name: Small bunch of fresh coriander, chopped

directions.Direction: Soak the toor dal over night then rinse well.
Place in a pot with the turmeric and hing and cover with water.
Cook until soft then mash with a whisk or pulse in a blender.
For the sambar powder toast every ingredients in stages in a dry pan for 2-3 minutes.
Transfer to a blender with the turmeric and hing then blend into a find powder.
Heat some oil and fry the shallots and green chillies.
Wash and cut the vegetables into even size pieces then add to the pan.
Add 2-3 tbsp of the sambar powder and fry for a few seconds. Cover with water and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the tamarind water and cooked dal. Bring to the boil and cook for 10 more minutes.
Correct the consistency with more water if needed. Then check if more salt is needed.
Heat some more oil in a small pot and temper the mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, hing, dried chilli and curry leaves.
Pour over the sambar and add the coriander leaves. Leave to sit with the lid on for 10 minutes before serving.
First, toast sesame seeds and blend or crush them in a pestle and mortar into a coarse powder.
Toast peanuts and set them aside.
Soak tamarind in boiling water for 10/15 minutes.
Heat a large pot, add oil, pop mustard and cumin seeds, then add hing and turmeric powder.
Fry urid and chana dal, then add dried and green chili; let curry leaves pop for a few seconds, and fry for a minute.
Add the soaked tamarind water and jaggery, letting it boil into a syrup-like consistency.
Season with salt, add 2 tbsp sesame powder and peanuts, mix with cooked rice, fry briefly, and serve.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Pulihora
Description: Incredible temple style fried rice

directions.Direction: First, chop your saag and spinach into strips and rinse the greens with water. Let the greens dry in a colander for a bit before further chopping the greens into pieces.
Following this, add your greens to a pan with salt to taste and water as needed to cook for 1.5 hours. The greens at the end of the cooking process should be wilted and no water should remain.
To the cooked greens, add your chopped garlic, chopped ginger, and chopped green chilli.
Continue to cook this in the pan before adding in your maize flour. Once complete, set that aside to begin making your sauce.

In another pan, add red onion and neutral oil. Let your onions get fragrant and glossy before adding in more chopped garlic, ginger, and green chilli. Let that cook before adding in your chopped tomatoes.
Once the tomatoes have combined with the other fragrants in the pan, add your coriander powder and some salt to taste.
Add some water (as needed) and the greens you set aside earlier to the tomato mixture before mixing and mashing the sabzi together.
Once ready, begin tempering your hing, sliced green chilli, dried red chilli, and chopped garlic in some neutral oil. Once fragrant, add the temper to your plated saag and enjoy with roti!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sarson ka saag
Description: A delicious savoury dish when you need to fill up on some extra greens. Enjoy this meal with some roti any time of year.

ingredients.Name: Small handful of fresh coriander, chopped

directions.Direction: Thoroughly wash the lentils and then drain them
Add to a pot with the turmeric, green chilli, salt, and cover with water
Bring to a boil and then simmer gently for about 45 minutes, stirring frequently
Heat a pot with the ghee, then add the ginger and dried red chilli and fry for a minute
Add the tomato and chilli powder and cook for a few minutes
Add the cooked dal with some water and salt. Bring back up to a light boil
Heat a small pan and add the oil
Once hot, add the mustard seeds. As soon as they pop, add the cumin seeds
Add the hing, curry leaves, and a little chilli powder
Cook for a few seconds, then pour into the pot of dal
Add fresh coriander and leave to sit for a few minutes with the lid on, off the heat before serving

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Masoor Amti
Description: Masoor Amti is a delicious and comforting dal, flavored with aromatic spices and herbs. It's a staple in Maharashtrian cuisine.

directions.Direction: Wash the beans and remove the hard woody ends.
Slice them finely and set aside.
Heat a large frying pan and add the oil.
Add the mustard seeds once the oil is hot but not smoking.
Once the mustard seeds pop, add the dried red chilli and stir-fry for 5 seconds.
Add the onions, turn the heat down, and let them soften for 3-5 minutes.
Add the chilli powder and stir.
Add the beans with a small splash of water.
Cook gently with the lid on for about 15 minutes.
Stir frequently.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Green Bean Bhaji
Description: Green Bean Bhaji is a flavorful Indian side dish made with fresh green beans, spices, and onions. It pairs well with rice or flatbreads.

directions.Direction: Wash, peel, and cut the potatoes into large pieces
Boil until fork-tender, then drain for 5 minutes to let excess steam evaporate
Heat the oil in a pan, then add the mustard seeds and let them pop. Add the cumin seeds
Add the garlic and green chilli, and fry for a minute or so. Do not let it burn
Add the turmeric and curry leaves, and fry for a few seconds
Mash the potatoes with your hand and add to the pan
Season with salt and lemon juice. Add the coriander leaves and mix well
Put the besan in a bowl and crush the ajwain seeds in with your hand
Slowly add water until it’s the consistency of double cream. Season with salt
Heat a pot of oil to 180 degrees Celsius
Roll the potato mix into balls, then dip them into the batter and carefully place them into the hot oil
Fry until golden and crisp
Serve with tamarind chutney

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Batata Vada
Description: Batata Vada is a popular Indian street food made of spiced mashed potatoes, coated in a gram flour batter, and deep-fried to golden perfection. Serve with tamarind chutney for a delightful snack.

directions.Direction: Heat a frying pan and add the oil.
Once hot but not smoking, add the cumin seeds.
When they sizzle, add the garlic and fry for a few seconds.
Add the green chillies and peanuts.
Cook this for 7-8 minutes on medium heat, stirring frequently.
Ensure all the ingredients turn a golden brown.
Transfer to a blender with the coriander leaves and salt, then blend.
Add tiny drops of water if needed.
It’s better done in a pestle and mortar; keep it chunky.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Thecha
Description: Thecha is a traditional spicy condiment from Maharashtra, India, made with peanuts, green chillies, and fresh coriander. It’s perfect as a side dish or dip to add a flavorful kick to your meals, usually paired with Bhakri.

directions.Direction: In a large bowl, add the besan and salt
Slowly add water with a whisk until you have a loose but smooth consistency
Add the tomato, onion, and coriander
Heat a nonstick pan and brush with oil
Once hot, add a ladle of the batter and turn the pan around until it coats the whole pan like a crepe
Turn the heat down to medium-low and wait 2-3 minutes
Gently spread a plastic spatula around the edges of the chilla to help it come away from the surface
Brush the top side with oil or ghee and then flip
Turn the heat up and cook for another minute on high heat
Repeat the process for the remaining batter

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Besan Chilla
Description: Besan Chilla is a savory Indian dosa/pancake made with gram flour and vegetables. It's quick to prepare and makes for a healthy breakfast or snack.

directions.Direction: First, soak your poha or flaked rice in water. Cover the poha with a cloth.
Following this, roast your peanuts in a pan and set aside.
Next, add neutral oil to a pan before adding your mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once the mustard seeds have popped and are fragrant, chop your green chillies and red onions and add them to the pan.
When the red onions are cooked, add your roasted peanuts and turmeric powder to the pan along with your soaked poha and salt to taste.
Mix the poha well (the turmeric should have dyed the poha yellow). Once ready, garnish with coriander and lemon juice.
Finally, plate up the poha and enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Kanda Poha
Description: A stunning dish usually served on a lazy Sunday morning, poha is the perfect meal to share with the family.

directions.Direction: Blend the dry chutney ingredients together and set aside.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together in a bowl and add the dry chutney.
Season with salt and lemon.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sukhi Bhel
Description: If you thought you knew how to make a snack....this will blow your mind!

directions.Direction: Slice the onions then massage with the salt and chilli powder.
Then add the gram flour and form into Bhajji shapes.
Fry in vegetable oil. High heat for 30 seconds then lower heat for a few more minutes.
Drain on a paper towel.
Pour some of the hot oil over the chutney ingredients and ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Kanda Bhajji
Description: The onion bhajia is popular in many parts of India. This is a delicious Mumbai street food variety.

ingredients.Name: kashmiri chillies soaked in boiling water for 30 minutes

directions.Direction: Add the potato, cauliflower, marrowfat peas, beetroot and tomatoes to a pot with water and salt. Cook for 30 minutes until soft then mash. Set aside.
Heat a couple tbsp of vegan butter and add the cumin seeds. Add the onion and fry for 5 minutes until soft.
Blend the kashmiri chillies into a paste and add too the pan.
Spoon out 2 tbsp of the pan mixture and set aside for later.
Add the bell pepper and fry for a few minutes.
Now add the mashed veg to the pan and keep mashing.
Add the ground coriander, turmeric and pav bhaji masala.
Add the fresh coriander and season with salt.
Add more butter about 2 tbsp. You can add a stick blender to the pan and slightly blend the mixture.
Toast the bread rolls in a pan with some of the reserved kashmiri chilli mixture and fresh coriander.
Serve together with raw onion and the kashmiri chilli chutney. ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Pav Bhaaji
Description: In my opinion this is the ULTIMATE street food. A symphony of flavours.

directions.Direction: Blend the chutney ingredients together and set aside.
Build the sandwich as follows: First butter, then green chutney, then potato, then onion, then tomato, then pepper season with chaat masala.
Repeat on second layer and add vegan cheese.
Toast the sandwich in a pan with butter or ghee and press down.
ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mumbai Sandwich
Description: I can't believe it took me 29 years to try a Mumbai sandwich!!!

directions.Direction: For the Thecha
Dry roast green chilies in a pan until slightly blackened.
Add neutral oil, cumin seeds, and garlic cloves to the pan, and roast.
Add salt to taste and mash the mixture using a mortar (it should be combined but not completely smooth).
For the Bhakri
In a pot, mix water, salt, and rice flour to form a coarse mixture.
Knead the mixture on a floured surface into a solid dough.
Divide the dough into four equal parts.
Roll out each part on a floured surface.
Cook the rolled-out bhakri on a hot, unoiled pan, flipping to cook both sides.
Serve the bhakri with the prepared thecha. Enjoy your delicious meal!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Thecha and Bhakri
Description: A perfect snack to serve with hot chai on a rainy day, this dish is not only spicy but extremely delicious.

directions.Direction: First, roast your peanuts, sesame seeds, and coconut separately (all should be fragrant) before blending smooth.
Next, add your turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala to the mixture.
Following this, add green chilies, grated ginger, finely chopped garlic, salt to taste, sugar, lemon juice, and coriander leaves to the same mixture. Your mixture should be coarse to the touch.

Following this, cut the bottom of your Indian eggplants in a cross (do not cut all the way through the vegetable). Once cut, stuff your eggplants with the stuffing mixture you made earlier (fill the slits to the top).
In a pan, add some neutral oil before adding mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once these pop, add your chopped white onion.
Before cooking your eggplants, add the leftover stuffing mixture that was not used to the pan with the onions.
Once combined, add water to the mixture and pour half of the mixture into the bottom of a pot. Place the eggplants into the pot before pouring the rest of the mixture on top of the eggplants.
Depending on the size of your eggplants, you will cook them either on the stove or in the oven.
If large, cover the pot before placing it in the oven for 30 to 40 mins.
Once the eggplants are cooked, garnish the dish with fresh coriander leaves and enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Bharli Vangi
Description: A perfect snack to serve with hot chai on a rainy day, this dish is not only spicy but extremely delicious.

directions.Direction: First, soak your channa dal in water before adding in your turmeric. Place the pot on your stove and cook until the dal is soft.
Next, take just the dal (pouring out any additional water) and mixing it with jaggery in another pan while cooking. As the mixture thickens, add your salt to taste and cardamom powder.
Strain this mixture with a sieve into another bowl so that your leftover mixture does not have any lumps. Break this up into medium or small balls (4 medium, 6 small). Set that aside.
Now for the outer dough, pour your bread flour and plain flour into a mixing bowl with salt to taste, turmeric, and your neutral oil.
Once this is combined, add your water and mix with your hands until you form a dough. Knead this dough for 10 mins or until your dough is smooth without lumps and easily to mold.
Place your smooth dough in a pot with some neutral oil in it and cover it with a cloth.
When ready to fill, break a portion of your dough off and stuff it with the sweet filling you made earlier.
Place your filled poli on a floured surface and roll it into a thin circle (1/4 inch thick). Once rolled, place on a hot pan.
After you flip the poli, add some ghee or oil to both sides before serving!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Puran Poli
Description: A delicious crunchy snack from Telangana served with cool yogurt. One of my favourite things to make when I seek comfort.

directions.Direction: First, buy dried or sprouted moth beans (if dry, sprout them before use). To these, add turmeric, salt to taste, and water. Boil this mixture for 15 mins on your stove.
Then, take some dried coconut and roast it until fragrant and slightly browned.
To another pan, add coriander seeds and dried kashmiri chilli. Roast this until fragrant before adding it to the same bowl as your roasted coconut.

Next, chop some red onion into slices and add it to a pan with some neutral oil, your sliced ginger, garlic cloves, and chopped tomato. Cook this until the tomato is soft and your onions are fragrant.
Once complete, add your coconut mixture and onion + tomato mixture to a blender, blending until the sauce is fine and combined.
In a new pan, add some neutral oil before popping some mustard and cumin seeds. Next, add your curry leaves to this before pouring your blended sauce in the same pan.
Add your red chilli powder, goda masala, and boiled moth bean mixture. Let that cook on low flame before adding salt to taste and your jaggery.
Serve topped with some Farsan/Mixture, chilli oil, and coriander, accompanying your toasted pav, chopped red onion, and green chillies.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Misal Pav
Description: A spicy Maharashtrian dish with sprouts, topped with crunchy snacks, and served with fluffy bread rolls. It's a fiery, flavorful street food favorite.

directions.Direction: 1. Slice the cucumber and carrot into fine slices. You can also use a julienne peeler if you have one.
2. Bash the lemongrass with the back of your knife then chop it along with the chilli and garlic into fine pieces.
3. Cook the beansprouts in boiling water for 1 minute then refresh in ice cold water.
4. Pick the herbs away from their stalks and add to a large bowl along with the cucumber, carrot and beansprouts.
5. Finely slice the shallot then add to the bowl. Chop the peanuts and add to the bowl.
6. Mix the dressing ingredients together and dress the salad and add half of the chopped chilli/lemongrass/garlic.
7. Slice the tofu and fry in vegetable oil until golden brown on both sides. Then add the remaining chilli/lemongrass/garlic.
8. Saute and mix for 45 more seconds. Season with salt and serve on top of the salad.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Beansprout salad 🔥
Description: Inspired by the flavours of Vietnam 🇻🇳

directions.Direction: 1. Cook your pasta in vigorously boiling water that has been salted.
2. Toast the walnuts in a pan then leave to cool slightly.
3. Blend the walnuts with the garlic, basil, mint, lemon juice, olive oil, salt & pepper. Add a little water to help it blend.
4. Slice the zucchini, asparagus and green beans into equal size pieces.
5. Sauté the vegetables in a pan with a little olive oil and salt until they soften slightly. Keep them slightly raw.
6. Add to a large bowl with the arugula and water cress. Add some lemon zest.
7. Add the drained pasta and pesto.
8. Mix well and serve with parmesan.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Pesto pasta salad
Description: A vibrant, fresh lemony pesto pasta salad perfect for summer.

directions.Direction: 1. Chop the tomato, cucumber, peppers and onion into a small dice.
2. Finely slice the fresh herbs.
3. Cook the pasta in salted boiling water.
4. Finely chop the garlic.
5. Heat a pot and add the olive oil and butter. Once warm add the garlic and sauté for a few seconds.
6. Add the herbs and spices and cook for a few seconds.
7. Add the pepper paste and cook for 4-5 minutes on a low flame. The oil will start to come out of the pepper paste once it’s ready.
8. Take the pan off the heat then add the lemon juice and pomegranate molasses. Season with salt and pepper.
9. Add the pasta, salad ingredients, herbs and dressing to a large bowl.
10. Mix well then serve.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Turkish style pasta salad
Description: My take on a pasta salad with classic Turkish flavours.

directions.Direction: 1. Start by finely dicing the carrot, celery, onion and garlic.
2. Heat the olive oil in a large pot and fry the garlic, bay leaf and rosemary for 5 seconds.
3. Then add the onion, celery, carrot.
4. Cook on a low flame, stirring quite often for about 10-15 minutes until nice and soft.
5. Add the cooked chickpeas with water and the stock cube.
6. Bring to a boil then turn down the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
7. Take some of the stew out and blend it until smooth then add back to the pot to thicken.
8. To finish, chop the dill and serve on top in bowls with more lemon.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Greek Chickpea Stew (Revithia)
Description: A hearty and flavorful Greek Chickpea Stew (Revithia), packed with tender chickpeas, fresh herbs, and a touch of lemon. Perfect for a cozy, nutritious meal.

ingredients.Name: dried red chilli or 1 tsp chilli flakes

directions.Direction: 1. Wash and soak the lentils for 30 minutes.
2. Then rinse them and add them to a pan with water and boil until cooked. (about 20-30 mins)
3. Heat the olive oil in a deep pan and add the bay leaf, rosemary and chilli.
4. Add the garlic and fry for a few seconds on a low heat.
5. Add the tomato paste and fry for a minute or so on a low heat.
6. Add the lentils and the cooking liquid to the pan.
7. Add some more water and a pinch of salt.
8. Simmer for 10 more minutes then take a couple ladles out and blend until smooth.
9. Add back to the pan to thicken.
10. Add the pasta with a little more water and cook until the pasta is cooked.
11. If the pasta has absorbed too much liquid you can add another splash of water to make it more oozy.
12. Top the pan with parmesan and put under the grill (broiler) until golden brown.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Pasta lenticchie
Description: A comforting and hearty Italian dish, Pasta Lenticchie features tender pasta and lentils simmered in a savory tomato broth with aromatic herbs. Perfect for a satisfying and nutritious meal. This one has a twist with the golden brown parmesan.

ingredients.Name: Small handful of fresh parsley, chopped

directions.Direction: 1. Soak the fava beans for 6 hours or overnight.
2. Rinse them and boil until tender. 1-2 hours or 35 minutes in instant pot pressure cook setting.
3. Drain then mash or pulse in a food processor with a little water.
4. Take 2 tbsp of tahini in a bowl and slowly add water and whisk until it becomes creamy.
5. Add the cumin, garlic, lemon juice and tahini to the mashed beans. Season with salt.
6. Mix well then add to a bowl.
7. Garnish with some peeled fava beans, olive oil, parsley and chilli powder.
8. Serve with the side pickle plate and warm flatbread.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Ful medames
Description: A traditional Levant & Egyptian dish, Ful Medames features slow-cooked fava beans seasoned with garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil, topped with fresh herbs. There are many variations and toppings, but this version is enriched with creamy tahini for an extra layer of flavor.

ingredients.Name: Large handful of fresh parsley, chopped

directions.Direction: 1. Soak the beans overnight.
2. Rinse them then add to a pot with water. Cook for 1-2 hours until very soft.
3. Finely chop the onion, red chilli, carrot and celery.
4. Grate the tomato.
5. Heat the olive in a large pot and add the onion and red chilli.
6. Add the thyme and bay leaf.
7. Cook it gently for 10 minutes.
8. Add the carrot and celery and cook for another 5 minutes.
9. Add the paprika and a pinch of salt then cook for another minute.
10. Add the grated tomato and the beans.
11. Make sure it’s covered with water. Add the stock cube.
12. Bring to a boil and cook for another 30 minutes.
13. Mash some of the beans to thicken the stew.
14. Finish with chopped parsley and more salt if needed.
1. Thoroughly wash the red lentils. Then add to a blender.
2. Pulse the blender and gradually add water so it starts to grind. It should not be very smooth.
3. Finely slice the onion, chop the coriander and green chilli.
4. Add the lentil mixture to a large bowl with the onions.
5. Add the coriander, green chilli, ginger/garlic.
6. Add the gram flour, chilli powder and a good pinch of salt.
7. Toast the fennel seeds in a dry pan and then add to the bowl.
8. Mix everything well.
9. Heat your oil for frying to about 160 celsius.
10. Add the mixture to the pan in any shape you like. You can make the Piyaji big or small.
11. Fry on both sides until golden brown and hot in the middle. Add some green chillies that have been pierced with a knife. Cook them for 30 seconds.
12. Drain on a paper towel.
13. If they are getting golden brown too quickly you can add them to the oven to warm through.
Serve with fresh lemon and the green chillies.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Piyaji (Bengali Lentil Fritters)
Description: Piyaji/Piyaju, or Bengali Lentil Fritters, are crispy, flavorful snacks made from seasoned lentil batter mixed with onions and spices, deep-fried to perfection. Perfectly golden and crunchy, they make an irresistible treat.

ingredients.Name: large tomatoes, cut into irregular shapes
cherry tomatoes, cut into irregular shapes
Peaches and white peaches, stoned and cut into pieces similar to the large tomatoes

directions.Direction: Start by cutting the sourdough bread into cubes. Toss the cubes with olive oil, fresh rosemary, salt, and pepper. Spread them on a baking sheet and bake at 180°C for 10-15 minutes, or until golden and crispy.
While the bread is baking, prep the tomatoes by cutting the large tomatoes and cherry tomatoes into irregular shapes. Finely slice the red onion and set aside.

Prepare the peaches and white peaches by removing the stones and cutting them into pieces similar in size to the large tomatoes. Heat a pan with olive oil and sear the peach pieces until they are golden on all sides but still firm.
In a bowl, squeeze the juice of one ripe peach by hand. Add 1-2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar, 3 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil, and season with salt and pepper to create the dressing.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the baked sourdough cubes, prepped tomatoes, red onion, seared peaches, torn fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Transfer the panzanella to a plate and serve immediately.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Grilled peach Panzanella salad
Description: Too good not to make. You can find vegan mozzarella these days if you want!

ingredients.Name: fresh turmeric or 2 teaspoons ground turmeric
nectarines, stones removed and roughly chopped
habanero or Scotch bonnet peppers (adjust to taste)

directions.Direction: Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the coriander seeds and fry for a minute until they release their aroma. Add the rosemary sprig, fresh turmeric (or ground turmeric), and garlic cloves. Cook for another minute, then add the chopped spring onions and carrot. Fry all the ingredients for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.

Add the roughly chopped nectarines and the habanero or Scotch bonnet peppers to the pan. Stir in the sugar, red wine vinegar, and salt. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nectarines are very soft and the flavors have melded together.

Allow the mixture to cool slightly. Then blend it until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. Taste the sauce and tweak the flavor to your liking by adding more sugar, vinegar, or salt if needed.
Pass the blended sauce through a fine strainer to achieve a smooth consistency. Pour the strained sauce into sterilized jars or bottles, seal tightly, and store in the refrigerator.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Nectarine hot sauce!!
Description: This vibrant and spicy nectarine hot sauce is a flavorful blend of sweet nectarines, fiery peppers, and aromatic spices. Perfect for adding a fruity kick to your favorite dishes.

ingredients.Name: light cherries, halved and stoned, then each half sliced in half
woodland mushrooms (or any choice), roughly chopped

directions.Direction: Start by preparing the bulgur wheat. In a bowl, soak one cup of bulgur wheat in boiling water with a pinch of salt. Cover the bowl with a plate and let it sit for thirty minutes until the bulgur wheat is tender and has absorbed the water.
While the bulgur is soaking, prepare the cherries by halving them, removing the stones, and slicing each half in half again. Chop the spring onions and parsley, and set them aside.

Next, prepare the mushrooms. Roughly chop the mushrooms. In a pan, heat four tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil infused with a whole clove of garlic over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and fry until they are golden brown, then season with salt and pepper. Remove the garlic clove after cooking.

In a large bowl, mix the soaked bulgur wheat, cooked mushrooms, sliced cherries, chopped spring onions, and parsley. Dress the salad with extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Red cherry & bulgar salad
Description: This refreshing red cherry and bulgur salad is reminiscent of tabbouleh, combining the nutty flavor of bulgur with the sweetness of cherries and the earthy taste of mushrooms. It's a delightful twist on a classic, perfect for a light lunch or a side dish.

directions.Direction: 1. Heat some oil in a pot and once hot add the cumin seeds, green chilli and hing. Fry for a few seconds.
2. Add the ginger and fry for a few more seconds.
3. Add the turmeric, chilli powder and coriander powder and fry for a few more seconds.
4. Cut the cauliflower into florets and slice the carrot. Add to the pan with a splash of water.
5. Mix well, cover with a lid and cook gently for 10-12 minutes. Check it from time to time, if it’s too dry add another splash of water.
6. For the green chutney simply blend all the ingredients together with water.
7. Assemble the sandwiches but first adding butter, green chutney, the cauliflower.
8. Then slice the garnish ingredients and add next. Cover with cheese and sprinkle over the chaat masala.
9. Close the sandwiches and cook in a frying pan with butter until golden brown on both sides.
10. Press them down with a plate and weight while frying.
11. Cut the sandwich into cubes and serve with more chutney.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Cauliflower (Mumbai Style) Sandwich
Description: This is a take on the original Mumbai Sandwich. Not traditional :)

directions.Direction: 1. Heat a pot with the mustard oil.
2. Once hot add the cumin seeds, cassia leaf, ginger/garlic, hing and green chilli.
3. Fry for a few seconds then add the coriander, chilli and turmeric powder.
4. Fry for a few more seconds then add the potato and spinach.
5. Season with salt and add a splash of water. Cover with a lid and cook gently for 12-15 minutes.
6. Once the potatoes are cooked give them a little mash with a spoon or fork then add the coriander.
7. Leave the potato mix to cool slightly.
8. To assemble the sandwich first add butter to the bread then the pickle.
9. Add the potato filling, the grated cheese and then the tomato and onion.
10. Finish with chaat masala and butter both exposed sides of the bread.
11. Cook in a pan on both sides and press down with a plate and weight.
12. Once both sides are golden and the middle is hot, it’s time to serve!
13. I served with a little garlic/chilli yogurt.
Make sure to civ the gram flour to remove any lumps then mix both bacon mix ingredients together in separate bowls.
Cook both mixes in separate pots until the mix has thickened.
Take a small tray lined with cling film and layer the mixes. The darker mix then the lighter mix then the darker mix on top. Let it set in the fridge.
Cut into slices. Then fry or bake until crisp.
Mix the vegan pesto and mayo together and coat the bread.
Layer up the lettuce, chickpea bacon and tomato. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Ultimate Vegan BLT
Description: This chickpea bacon is a game changer!

ingredients.Name: Large handful of Swiss chard or spinach

directions.Direction: Slice the mushrooms and fry with in olive oil until golden. Then add chopped garlic, chopped scallion and vegan butter. Fry for a few more minutes then season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

Heat some more olive oil and infuse with a whole clove of garlic and a pinch of chili flakes. Add the chard and let it wilt down for a few minutes. Season with salt, pepper and a squeeze of lemon. Then drain on a paper towel.
Butter the bread. Then build the sandwich by first putting the chard then mushrooms then cheese. Place under the grill/broiler to melt the cheese. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Garlic mushroom ciabatta
Description: Garlic mushrooms and greens are not the typical sandwich filling... but an absolutely amazing combo!

ingredients.Name: Potato wedges baked in olive oil and salt

directions.Direction: Fry the oyster mushrooms in a frying pan. Press them down to make sure they get good collar on both sides.
Once they are golden brown you can then add the spices and salt. Cook for a few more minutes. You may need to add more olive oil to keep them moist and prevent burning.
Slice the mushrooms once cooked.
Mix the tahini with water gradually. It will take a lot of water. Keep adding it until it becomes super smooth. Then add the yogurt, salt and lemon. Set aside.
Mix the tomato, onion, parsley and lemon together with salt. Slice the pickles.
Heat the flatbread then add the tahini sauce then the mushrooms. Now add the salad, pickles and potatoes.
You can add more sauce then roll it up and ENJOY!
Mash the avocado with lime and salt then set aside.
Crumble both tofu into a pan with the onion powder, turmeric and black salt. Fry for a few minutes until slightly golden.
Mix the tomato, onion lime and coriander together with salt.
Layer up the sandwich with the tofu, bacon, cheese, avocado then salad.
Toast the sandwich in a pan until golden on both sides.
To make the sauce chop the onion and slice the garlic. Fry gently in olive oil until soft.
Then add the vegan nduja. You can use Calabrian chili paste instead. Fry it for 2 minutes.
Then add the vodka but be careful with the flame. Let it reduce for a minute.
Add the tomatoes, basil and 1/2 cup water. Cook the sauce for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice the eggplant. Season with salt and pepper then coat in the flour, then flour/milk mixture then breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot vegetable oil until golden brown on both sides. Drain on a paper towel.
Layer sandwich first by buttering the toasted ciabatta.
Then add the sauce, then the eggplant, then cheese. Let the cheese melt under the grill. Top with fresh basil and ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Eggplant parm, vegan nduja vodka sauce ciabatta

ingredients.Name: citric acid or juice of half a lemon
Grilled antipasti vegetables (artichoke, peppers, zucchini etc)

directions.Direction: To make the mozzarella blend all the ingredients together then cook in a pot until very thick.
Spoon the mixture in a bowl of ice water to form mozzarella balls.
Leave them to cool for a few hours.
Mix the vegan cream cheese and cream together then tear in the mozzarella. Season with salt and set aside.
Slice your tomatoes and season with salt, pepper and olive oil.
To make the sandwich toast the ciabatta and add your vegan burrata mix.
Add the grilled veg, then tomatoes then arugula. Squeeze over some fresh lemon and ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Vegan burrata & grilled veg ciabatta
Description: An amazing plant based alternative to a classic Italian deli sandwich.

directions.Direction: Wash the poha and leave it aside.
In a pan, heat some oil, add mustard, cumin and fennel seeds. Let it splatter for a few seconds and then add chopped green chillie, hing and turmeric powder.
In the washed poha, add 1/2 tsp sugar, salt to taste, turmeric powder and some lemon juice.
Mix the tempering into the poha and in a separate vessel boil some water and steam the prepared poha for 10 minutes.
The poha is now ready to serve. Serve it hot with freshly chopped coriander and onions. top it with some penuts, sev and jeeravan. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Indori poha
Description: A spice infused comfort, straight from the heartland.

ingredients.Name: A thumb of finely chopped ginger

directions.Direction: In a bowl grate sweetcorn and leave it aside.
In a separate pan, heat some oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, let splatter. Then, add hing, turmeric powder, ginger, some green chilli and saute.
Now, add the grated corn and salt to taste and mix for a few minutes until fragrant.
Now, add some milk to the mixture and cook until everything comes together and stops sticking to the pan.
Bhutte ki kees is now ready. Serve it hot, topped with some freshly chopped coriander, lemon juice and jeeravan masala.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Bhutte Ki kees
Description: Corn on the cob’s spicy alter ego.

ingredients.Name: A finely chopped thumb of ginger

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, add some flour and semolina, salt, sugar and some baking powder.
In a separate pan, heat some ghee. Add hing, fennel seeds, ajwain seeds, red chilli powder and turmeric powder. Add this mixture/tempering to the flour.
Now, add 1/2 cup yogurt in the mixture and add some water to make a firm dough. Set it aside for 10-15 minutes.
Form balls from the dough and press a little and boil the dough balls into some seasoned water.
Once boiled, shallow fry the bafla in some ghee. Bafla is now ready
In a pressure cooked, heat some oil. Add cumin seeds and let splatter for a few seconds. And then, add hing, bay leaves, peppercorns and cloves.
To this, add chopped onions, ginger and garlic. And cook until soft. Following this, add chopped tomatoes add some salt to taste and cook until soft.
Add the chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder and mix everything.
Add the soaked dal and let simmer. now, add some peanuts and sesame seeds powder to the mixture.
Cover the lid and let pressure cook the mixture for 4-5 whistles.
In a separate pan, for the tempering, add some oil, cumin seeds and whole red chillies and add the mixture to the dal once ready.
Your dal bafla is ready to serve. Enjoy!
In a pot/vessel bring some milk to boil.
To this add a pinch of turmeric, a few strands of saffron and cardamom powder.
Continue boiling the mixture and then add some sugar. Once the milk is boiled well and starts to form cream, take it off the stove and let it cool.
Next, after the milk cools down, add it to a grinding jar along with some raisins and cashews and form a paste (flow consistency).
Add the mixture to the hung curd and mix well.
Add the boiled milk to this mixture and give it a good stir.
The shikanji is now ready to serve. top it with some chopped pistachios and serve it cold.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Shrikanji
Description: A sip of tradition, a splash of cool.

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat some oil and add roughly chopped garlic, red whole chillies, green chillies and saute.
Add chopped potatoes and saute for a minute and then move on to adding chopped tomatoes
Next, add salt to taste and turmeric and give everything a good mix.
Add a handful of amaranth leaves, mix everything and simmer until the potatoes are cooked properly.
The lal bhaji is ready. You can serve it warm with roti. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Lal bhaji
Description: A taste of tradition, a burst of color.

ingredients.Name: A handful of fresh coriander with stalks

directions.Direction: In a blender, add spring onion, coriander, cumin, tomato, salt and lemon juice and blend to make chutney.
In a mixing bowl, add rice flour, shredded carrot, chopped onions, chopped coriander, salt to taste and some water to make the batter of flow consistency.
Take a pan, spread the batter and let it bubble. Once that happens, add some oil to fry the chilla.
Continue the step for the rest of the batter.
The chillas are ready and can be served warm with the green chutney. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Chilla
Description: A simple, savory satisfaction.

directions.Direction: In a blender jar, add soaked rice, red whole chillies, mango, ginger, garlic and some water and blend it into a flow consistence paste.
In a separate vessel, boil some water, add bamboo shoots, black boiled chickpeas and cook for some minutes.
Next, add chilli powder, salt and turmeric powder. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Now, add the blended paste to the mixture and boil until everything is soft and cooked.
Aamat is now ready. Serve hot, topped with some fresh coriander. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aamat
Description: Forest fresh flavours in every spoonful.

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, add the left over rice. Add some rice flour and water and mash everything to form a dough like consistency.
Form small balls from the mixture and create your desired shape and keep aside.
In a different pan, heat some oil and ass whole red chillies, sesame seeds, green chillies, curry leaves and onions.
Cook the onions until soft and golden. Now, add the chopped potatoes and let everything simmer for a few minutes.
Next, add the chopped tomatoes, salt, and turmeric powder. Add some water and cook everything till the gravy is thick and potatoes are cooked.
Once done, add the muthia to the mixture and simmer for a few minutes.
The muthia is now ready. Serve with chutney or sauce of your desire. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Muthia
Description: A quick and tasty go to snack.

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, to the wheat flour, add a pinch of salt, ajwain seeds, and kalonji.
Add some water to this mixture and knead a dough and set aside.
In another mixing bowl, add coarse chickpea flour, ginger, garlic, cumin powder, chopped green chillies, chopped onions, chopped coriander, some lemon juice and salt to taste.
To prepare the paratha, divide the dough into medium sized balls and roll a little. Stuff the chickpea flour mixture in the paratha and seal it well.
Roll it into a paratha and cook on the pan. once semi cooked, add some oil to fry (can also use ghee or butter).
Repeat the process and the parathas are now ready.
Serve warm with sides of your choice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sattu paratha
Description: The earthy essence of sattu dances with the warmth of spices, that linger long after the last bite

directions.Direction: In a mortar and pestle grind ginger, garlic, cumin seeds, and peppercorns and set aside.
In your pressure cooker, heat some oil, add the grounded paste, cassia leaves, and onions and cook until the onions are soft.
To this mixture, add chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and some salt to taste and saute for a few minutes.
Once the oil starts to separate, add soaked kala chana to the mixture and some water.
Bring everything to boil once and cover the lid and let everything pressure cook for 15 minutes on a medium flame.
The ghugni is now ready to serve. Top it off with freshly chopped coriander. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Ghugni
Description: A burst of spice, a dash of tradition and a whole lot of flavor.

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat 1 tbsp oil, shallow fry the peanuts and set that aside.
In another pan/vessel, heat mustard oil, add red whole chillies, chopped onions, green chillies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the onions are golden and soft.
To this add some turmeric powder, poha and salt to taste. Give everything a good mix.
Add the fried peanuts to the mixture and mix until the poha feels crispy.
Chura ke bhujia is now ready to serve. Enjoy!
Crush peeled and halved potatoes in a mortar and pestle, and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard, cumin, hing, green chili, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté briefly.
Cook onions till soft and golden.
Add pureed tomato, cook for a few minutes.
Stir in red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook till oil separates.
Add potatoes and water. Mix well and cook for 25 minutes.
Serve warm with roti or rice. Enjoy your aloo ki thechwani!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo ki thechwani
Description: Comforting balance of rustic flavors.

directions.Direction: For the roti
Mix finger millet flour and salt in a bowl.
Gradually knead with warm water into a soft dough.
Divide into 2 portions and roll into balls.
Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat.
Flatten one dough ball into a disc and cook on the tawa until golden brown spots appear on each side (1-2 minutes).
Brush with ghee or oil while cooking for extra flavor.
Repeat with the other dough ball.
Serve hot with til ki chutney or your favorite curry.
For the til ki chutney
Dry roast the cumin and sesame seeds and set them aside.
To a blending jar add fresh coriander, fresh mint, garlic cloves, ginger, green chillies, roasted sesame and cumin and blend to a paste.
Add some salt to taste and lemon juice to the paste.
Til ki chutney is now ready. Serve it fresh with warm madua ki roti or as a side with your meal. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Madua ki roti & Til ki chutney
Description: Tradition's warmth, cooked to perfection. A flavorful fusion to elevate any dish.

directions.Direction: Dry roast urad dal in a pan and grind it into coarse powder
Add ginger, garlic, coriander seeds, cumin seeds and black peppercorns in mortar and pestle and make a paste.

In a separate vessel, heat mustard oil, add jakhiya seeds (they are wild mustard seeds, used in pahadi food) and let pop. Next, add hing, dry red chillies and the ground ginger-garlic paste. Cook for a good minute.
Next to this mixture, add coarsely ground urad dal, some wheat flour and turmeric powder. Mix everything for a few minutes, and add water to adjust consistency.
Add salt to the mixture and bring the dal to boil. Adjust the consistency by adding some water as per your choice. Keep boiling until the dal is cooked well.
The chaunsa dal is now ready. Serve with warm steamed rice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Chaunsa dal
Description: A comforting hug for your taste buds.

ingredients.Name: Chopped nuts for garnish (almonds,cashews, and raisins)

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat 1 tbsp ghee and roast the dried nuts. Set them aside once golden.
In the same pan, add jhangora, and dried nuts and roast for a few minutes.
Add milk and bring it to boil. Make sure to stir periodically.
Keep boiling until the mixture is thick but flow consistency and the jhangora is cooked.
Once the kheer reaches the required consistency, add jaggery (make sure its chopped or in small pieces). Cook until the jaggery melts.
Serve the kheer warm topped with ghee roasted nuts. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Jhangora ki kheer
Description: A delicious revelation, redefining sweet euphoria.

ingredients.Name: Chopped nuts for garnish (almonds,cashews, and raisins)
strands of saffron soaked in 4 tbsp water

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat some ghee and roast the dried nuts and raisins. Set it aside.
In the same pan, heat some ghee, add cloves, cinnamon, cardamom and fennel seeds. Toast them for a few seconds and then, add soaked basmati rice and mix.
Add sugar, saffron soaked water,milk and a pinch of turmeric to this mixture and give everything a good mix.
Cook the rice on low flame.
Once cooked, leave the rice off heat with the lid on for 5-10 min.
Meethe chawal are now ready to serve. Top them with some roasted nuts and raisins and serve warm. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Meethe chawal
Description: A delicious blend of sweetness and spice.

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl add yougurt. To the yogurt, add chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala and give it a good mix.
In a separate vessel, heat some ghee/oil and add cumin seeds, cassia leaves, whole red chillies, mace, clove, green chillies, and peppercorn. Saute the spices for a few seconds until fragrant.
Add the yogurt to the mixture and stir continuously to make sure it doesn’t separate.
Add some salt to taste and water to the mixture and bring it to boil.
Now, add boiled chickpeas and simmer for 15 minutes.
Channa madra is now ready. Serve it with warm rice or roti. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Chana madra
Description: A savory delight from the heart of Himachal Pradesh.

ingredients.Name: A few tablespoons of Mustard oil

directions.Direction: In a pressure cooker, add dal, and water.
To the dal and water, add black cardamom, green cardamom, bay leaves, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, mustard oil, salt to taste, and two cloves.
Mix and bring the  mixture to a boil.
Close the lid to the pressure cooker and, pressure cook the dal for 20 minutes.
Let the vessel cool down for a few minutes and the dal is ready. Serve it with steamed rice or roti. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Teli Maah
Description: This dal defines simplicity.

directions.Direction: Combine yeast, water, and sugar in a bowl and let it activate.
In another bowl, mix plain flour, activated yeast, salt, and water to form a dough.
Coat the dough with oil/ghee, cover, and set aside.
Grind soaked urad dal into a paste, then add chilli, turmeric and coriander powder, and salt, hing, ginger, green chillies and coriander.
Once the dough rises, make balls, roll thick, add urad dal filling, seal edges, and flatten them into disks. Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients.
Steam the siddus for about 25 minutes.
Serve warm with chutney or a side of your choice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Siddu
Description: Steamed parcels of joy, bursting with flavors.

directions.Direction: Heat oil in a pan, fry chopped vegetables until golden, then set aside.
In another pan, heat oil, add cumin, fenugreek, hing. Let them pop, then add curry leaves, ginger, green chilies. Saute briefly, add besan, cook until fragrant.
Pour in 2 cups water, add chili and turmeric powder, season with salt, and bring to a boil.
Reintroduce fried vegetables, adjust consistency with water, and simmer until cooked.
Serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sindhi kadhi
Description: A new definition of comfort.

directions.Direction: Cut the potatoes in equal halves, wash and set them aside. Meanwhile, in a pot, heat oil to fry the potatoes.
Pat dry the washed potatoes with a clean cloth. Once the potatoes are dry, put them in the oil and fry until they are golden and cooked.
Let the potatoes cool down a little and then, press the potatoes with a small bowl or the bottom of a mug.
Re-fry the potatoes after mashing till they turn golden brown.
In a separate pan, heat a few tablespoons of oil, add chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, amchoor powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt to taste and some pepper.
Next, add the potatoes to the spice mixture and give everything a good mix.
Top the potatoes with some lemon/lime juice and fresh coriander and serve. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo tuk
Description: Crispy, tangy and spicy. Will make you fall in love with potatoes all over again.

ingredients.Name: A handful of chopped fresh coriander

directions.Direction: In a mixing bowl, combine wheat flour, besan, ajwain, dried fenugreek, green chillies, chilli powder, turmeric powder, chopped onion, amchoor powder, coriander leaves, ghee and salt to taste.
Add water and knead the dough. The dough should be firm but not too stiff. Let the dough rest for 10 min.
Divide the dough into medium sized balls and roll it thick (make sure to not roll it fully). Partially cook the dough and set aside. Repeat the process with rest of the dough.
Next, roll the partially cooked dough and cook it well on both the sides and apply ghee while cooking. Repeat the process with the rest of the dough.
Serve it hot with yogurt, pickles, curry or chai. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Koki roti
Description: A new way to eat roti. My new favorite

directions.Direction: In a pressure cooker, heat some oil. Add cumin seeds and let pop for a second. Add onions, crushed ginger, green chillies and saute until the onions are golden brown.

Next, add chopped tomatoes and once they are soft, add turmeric, coriander powder, chilli powder and salt to taste. Mix everything and add the chopped vegetables (potatoes, carrots, eggplants and drumsticks) give everything a good mix.
Add the soaked chana dal, spinach and dill. Add water according to the consistency of your desire and pressure cook everything for 15 min.
In a separate pan, heat some oil, add chopped garlic, hing, chilli powder for tempering. Once the bhaji is cooked, add the tempering on top.
Sai bhaji is now ready. Serve it with steamed rice, roti or koki. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sai bhaji
Description: A new way to eat protein and greens.

directions.Direction: Blend the green paste ingredients with water and set aside.
Heat some oil in a pan add the hing and cassia leaves and cumin seeds. Let the cumin seeds pop.
Add fresh coriander leaves, turmeric and chilli powder. Cook out the spices for a few seconds.
Add the besan and mix to get rid of lumps. Add some water and the green paste.
Cook on a low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Break up the boiled potatoes and add to the pan.
Mix some hing and amchoor with water and add to the pan.
Make a final tadka with oil, chilli powder, turmeric powder, dried chillies and coriander leaves.
Add to the pan and check if it needs salt. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dubki wale aloo
Description: My new comfort potato dish.

directions.Direction: Mix the wheat flour, semolina, salt, ajwain and methi in a bowl.
Add the salt and water to form a dough.
Add 2-3 tbsp of oil and knead the dough for 10-12 minutes.
Let it rest covered for 10 minutes.
Grind the urid dal into a course powder and set aside.
Heat a couple tablespoons of oil in a pan and temper the fennel and cumin seeds.
Add the rest of the spices and cook for a couple minutes on a low flame to cook out the spices.
Add the urid dal and fry for a couple minutes.
Add salt and water to form the mixture into a consistency that can be moulded into ball shapes.
Take some dough and form into ball shapes then roll out into a disc but keep quite thick.
Add some filling and connect the sides of the disc to completely encase the filling.
Roll out the filled ball of dough into a thick disk as shown in the video.
Fry in vegetable oil and carefully flick oil on to it while cooking to allow it to puff up.
Once golden on both sides it’s ready to enjoy.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Bedmi puri
Description: Crunchy, fine and simply flavorful.

directions.Direction: To a pressure cooker, add soaked dal, water, turmeric and salt to taste. Pressure cook for 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat 2-3 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, whole red chillies, and chopped garlic. Saute everything for a few seconds.
Add boiled dal to the mixture and add some water to adjust consistency. Bring everything to boil.
Arhar ki dal is ready. Serve it with warm roti or steamed rice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Arhar ki dal
Description: A new addition to my list of comfort dal.

directions.Direction: In a medium sized bowl, add water, cumin powder, sugar, chilli powder, turmeric powder and hing. Mix everything until the sugar is dissolved.

In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, ginger, green chillies, cashews and poppy seeds. Saute everything on a low-medium flame and next add chilli powder, coriander and cumin powder, turmeric powder, black salt, amchoor, and garam masala. Saute everything for a minute on low flame.
Next, add chopped tomatoes, and let cook till they release juices.
Next, to the whole mixture add boiled potatoes (roughly crushed with hand). Mix everything.
Let the mixture summer for about 5 minutes. Once done, add fresh coriander, lemon/lime juice and salt to adjust taste.
Let simmer for a few minutes.
The tomato chat is now ready to serve.
Top it with the cumin/hing syrup, ghee, classic green chutney, fine chopped onions, sev and chaat masala. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Tamatar ki chaat
Description: Fresh, firery and full of zest.

directions.Direction: In a blending jar, blend some soaked tamarind along with some water and form a paste. Strain the paste to separate the pulp.
In a sauce pan, heat some oil and pop some cumin seeds and hing. Next, add the pulp into the sauce pan. Add some jaggery, black salt and some cumin powder, mix and bring it to a boil.
In a mixing bowl, mix some yogurt and salt, adjust the consistency with water (thick but flow consistency)
In another mixing bowl, mash boiled potatoes. Add salt, coriander and green chillies. Next, add some flour to bind the potatoes and roll them into tikkis.
Heat some oil/ghee on a flat pan (tawa) and shallow fry the tikkis until they are crispy golden brown.
Assemble the tikkis in a plate drizzle some green chutney, tamarind chutney and yogurt. Top it all with some chaat masala and sev. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo tikki chaat
Description: My new favorite snack.

directions.Direction: Take your potatoes and dice them into medium sized pieces.
For the poppy seeds paste:

In a blender, take 2 cups of poppy seeds along with 1 cup of water and blend until it is a fine paste. (Tip: Soak your poppy seeds in 1 cup of water for 15 minutes and then blend it for a more smooth paste)
In a pan, heat up mustard oil. To it, add a pinch of hing, cumin seeds and dried chili. Sauté it for a moment and then add your diced potatoes.
Now add 1 tsp of turmeric and salt as per the taste. Add 1 sliced onion to it and let it cook for a minute.
Add red chili powder to it & then goes in your poppy seeds paste. Cook that for a moment & add a chopped green chili to it.
Finally, add 1 cup of water, cover it & let it cook for 10 minutes in medium to low heat. Make sure the potatoes are properly cooked and here you are with the most delicious aloo posto.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo posto
Description: A staple household Bengali recipe of potatoes in a lightly spiced poppy seeds paste. A classic example of how just a few ingredients can yield a creamy spiced potato dish.

directions.Direction: Take 2 cups of masoor dal with 2 cups of water. Add them to the instant pot for 10 minutes.
Take an unripe mango & cut it into medium sized slices.
In a pan, add mustard oil along with mustard seeds& dried chilli. Add the sliced mango to it with 1tsp turmeric powder & salt to taste. Saute it for 2-3 minutes.
When the masoor dal is cooked, add it to the pan with salt & sugar. Wait until the mangoes are cooked. (you can check by pressing a finger into the mango slice, it shouldn't be too hard to press)
Add ½ cup of water or as much required & now your aam dal is ready.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aam (tok) dal
Description: Tok Dal or aam dal is a lip smacking Bengali lentil soup made using Raw mangoes & masoor dal. It is easy, light and is perfect to be served as a side dish with your Indian meal.

directions.Direction: Combine plain flour and oil, gradually adding 2/3 cup of water. Knead the mixture into a smooth, pliable dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes under a moist cloth.

Rinse 2 cups of urad dal and soak in 1 cup of water for 4-5 hours. Grind with 3 tablespoons of water until semi-coarse. Sauté the paste with 2 tablespoons of oil, a pinch of hing, salt, 1 teaspoon of powdered sugar, and a spice mix (cumin seeds, fennel seeds, nutmeg, dried chili) until thickened.
Divide the rested dough into 6 portions. Spread oil on both sides, flatten with fingers, place a smaller urad dal ball, seal, and roll into a medium-sized puri.
Heat oil for frying. Slide each puri, let it puff up, and nudge gently for even puffing. Fry until the base is light golden.
Serve hot, optionally with your favorite chutney or yogurt. Enjoy the delightful stuffed urad dal puris!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Radhaballavi
Description: Radhaballavi is a Bengali style urad dal puri where the stuffing is made of white lentils or urad dal, khoya and a couple of spices.

directions.Direction: To begin making Bengali Dhokar Dalna Recipe, we will first prepare dhoka i.e the lentil cake. Soak the chana for a few hours, then grind it with green chilli, sugar, salt, coconut & a little water to form a fine paste.
Take 2 tsp of oil in a pan, to it add cumin seeds with crushed ginger with a pinch of hing/asafoetida.

Add the chana dal mixture to the pan & Stir it till the chana dal mixture dries and comes together. Add 1tsp each of cumin, coriander & chilli powder to it. Add a little water to it and again mix it until the mixture dries.
Take a plate and grease it with some oil, put the mixture on it and pat down to spread evenly. Let it cool down & Cut in medium sized rectangular or square pieces.

In a bowl, add 1 cup of plain flour with 1 cup of water to make a slurry (not thick or not too thin). Dip the pieces into it & add it to a pan with hot oil for frying. Fry until they are nice golden brown.
For the gravy, in a pan, add 3-4 tbsp of mustard oil. Put 1 diced potato to it and fry it until some of its side turn light golden brown in color. Take them out.
In the same pan & oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds along with cassia leaves and 1 tsp crushed ginger. Saute it for a moment before adding 1tsp each of cumin, coriander, chilli powder & turmeric.
Add a cup of water to it & throw the potatoes in with some chopped green chillies. Add a little salt to it & cover the lid for the potatoes to cook.
Once the potatoes are done, add the fried dhokas in the gravy. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle garam masala powder and a teaspoon of ghee and give it a stir.
Switch off the flame, cover and keep it for sometime for flavors to blend well before serving.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dhokar Dalna
Description: A delicious Bengali treat, lentil cakes with potato cubes dipped in a thick gravy, is best served with steamed rice or luchi.

directions.Direction: Prep all the vegetables. Fry the bori (fried lentil dumplings) until it is nice golden brown color.
In a pan, take oil. Shallow fry the bitter gourd, aubergine separately for a minute and take it out.

Now in that oil, add 2 tsp panchphoran (Nigella, cumin, mustard, Fenugreek, fennel seeds). Add potatoes & cassia leaf. Saute it for a minute & then add the other vegetables. It's time to add the ginger alongwith salt to taste & 2tsp of sugar.
Add shallow fried bitter gourd and aubergine to it and mix them very well.
