In a blender, add 1 cup of poppy seeds with ½ cup of mustard seeds ,1½ cup of water . Grind them into a very fine paste.
Add this paste to the vegetables in the pan. Give it a good mix and add 1 cup of water to it. Now add the fried bori & cover the lid to let all the veggies cook in medium or low flame.
Take 2tsp panch phoran & dry roast it for a few secknd. In a mortar and pestle, crush the roasted panchphoran & add 3tsp water to it.
To the veggies, add this crushed panchphoran mixture & our delicious shukto is ready.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Shukto
Description: Shukto is a classic Bengali side dish that is served at the beginning of the meal. It is a light tasty stew made with variety of vegetables that goes so perfect with hot rice. So comforting & yummy.

directions.Direction: First, blend the soaked urad dal in a blender until it is a fine paste. Whisk the Urad dal paste for a few minutes with your hands & add salt to taste (TIP: Soak Urad dal for 7-8 hours or overnight).

Add semolina to your paste and now it's time to make vada. Wet your hands and make small balls (bara/vada) in your hands with the paste. Make little holes in the middle to shape the balls (bara/vada).
Fry the balls until they are golden brown. Now transfer the balls to plain water.

Add 1 cup yogurt to a bowl, add ½ cup of water to it along with Cumin powder, dried chilli powder and chopped coriander leaves. To give tempering to the yogurt mixture, heat up 3tbsp of oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, dried chilli & hing. Pour tempering over the yogurt mixture.

It's time to remove the fried balls (bara/vada) from plain water and transfer them to the yogurt mixture. Make sure to press out the excess water from the bara/vada before transferring to the yogurt mixture.
Now for the aloodum/aludum, add 2-3 tbsp of mustard oil to a pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, dried chilli, cardamom, cinnamon and saute for a minute.
Add 1 chopped onion with a tbsp of ginger and let it cook for a minute. Now you can add chopped tomatoes. Cover it & let it cook for around 4 minutes.
Add your spices like turmeric, chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder (1 tsp each). Let the spices cook out properly.
Then you can add your boiled potatoes (cut a single potato into 4 pieces; nice & chunky). Add 1 & ½ cups of water to it & salt to taste.
When the Gravy starts boiling, add your garam masala & handful of chopped coriander leaves.
It's time to assemble; In a plate, put your Dahibara (soaked vada along with yogurt). Add some aloodum on top of it. Garnish with some chopped onion & sev. Enjoy :)

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dahibara Aloodum
Description: A famous & unique Street food dish of Odisha. Soft dahibara topped with spicy aloodum will satisfy your taste buds like no other.

directions.Direction: Boil your soaked toor dal until it's properly cooked.

Cut your vegetables like aubergine, pumpkin, bottle gourd, ridge gourd, plantain, saru & potatoes into medium sized chunky pieces. Add veggies to the cooked dal along with a bay leaf, 1tsp turmeric, salt to taste, 1-2 tsp Ghee with grated coconut. Add 1½ cups of water & Cover the lid and let it cook in low heat until all the vegetables are done in there.
For the tadka
Heat up 1 tsp of ghee. Add hing, 1tsp cumin seeds & 3-4 dried chilli to it. Add one chopped tomato & cook for a minute.
Then add the cooked dal & vegetables to the tadka. Add little salt according to the taste.
For the dalma powder
Saute some cumin seeds (2tsp), dried chilli (5-6), black peppercorns (2-3tsp) & bay leaf (3-4) in a pan. Transfer it to a blender & this powder formed is the dalma powder.
Add 2-3 tsp of dalma powder to the dal. Finish off with some chopped coriander leaves & grated coconut.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Dalma
Description: The soulful taste with the goodness of veggies is what I call Dalma.

directions.Direction: First, chop your vegetables & keep them aside. Now in a pot, boil 5-6 cups of water. Add 1tsp of turmeric &salt to taste. Add the chopped vegetables (except okra) alongwith ½ cup of green peas, ½ cup of boiled chickpeas & black chickpeas into the pot. Also, add a handful of peanut to it. Now cover the lid & let it cook until all the vegetables are completely done.

Now in another pan or pot, add 2tbsp mustard oil. Add 1tsp cumin seeds & mustard seeds each along with dried red chilli & bay leaf. Saute it for a bit & then add ginger ,chopped tomatoes & okra and now cook it for a minute.
Add in your spices like hing, small amount of turmeric, 1tsp each of chilli powder, cumin powder & coriander powder. Saute & cook the spices properly
To it, add all your cooked vegetables. Saute together & cook for a minute .Add salt to taste & 1tsp of garam masala.
Chop a small bunch of coriander leaves & add to it. Garnish it off with some grated coconut

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Ghanta Tarkari
Description: Signature odia recipe cooked with lots of pulses and legumes. Bowl of nutrition and taste if you ask me.

directions.Direction: First, make the Mustard paste. In a bowl, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, dried chili & garlic. Add one cup of water to it and let it soak there for 10-15 minutes. Transfer it into a blender and make a fine paste.

Now, take your button mushrooms & cut them into medium sized slices. Add 1 tsp of oil, 1 tsp of turmeric & salt to taste. Mix them well, air fry for 15 minutes or saute them with some oil until they release some water & get cooked.
Mix all the seeds mentioned in equal amount and your panchphoran is ready. (Tip: use a little less Fenugreek seeds as they are a little bitter)

Now in a pan, add 2 tbsp mustard oil & when it's hot, add 2 tsp panchphoran to it. Add your slitted green chillies, 1 cup chopped onion & roughly ½ cup of chopped tomatoes. Cover it and let it cook for around 2 minutes
Add the mustard paste to the pan. To that, add 1 tsp of turmeric, 1 tsp red chili powder & salt to taste.
Add 1½ cups of water to it & put 1 cup of diced potatoes. Cover the lid until the potatoes are cooked.
Once the potatoes are cooked, add in your sauteed or airfried mushrooms. Mix that well & this deliciousness is ready to serve. Enjoy with some Hot Roti or Rice.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Chhatu besara
Description: This recipe features a traditional spicy & savoury mushroom gravy in a mustard sauce. Pairs perfect with Roti, naan, rice, you name it.

directions.Direction: Soak the chickpeas overnight then rinse well.
Boil in water until soft.
Toast the chilli powder, coriander powder and garam masala in a dry pan for 2 minutes.
Mix the toasted spice mixture with water to form a paste. Then set aside.
Heat a pot with 2 tbsp coconut oil then pop the mustard seeds then add the dried red chilli.
Add the curry leaves and onions and fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add the cooked chickpeas and water.
You can toast the coconut in a dry pan then add to the chickpeas for better flavour.
Add 2 tbsp of the spice paste to the chickpeas with a pinch of salt.
Cook for 10 minutes until the oil splits. Then serve.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Kadala curry
Description: Typical breakfast in Kerala

directions.Direction: Wash and peel the carrots. Then grate or blend the carrots to make a fine cut.
Heat the coconut oil and pop the mustard seeds.
Add the onion, green chillies and curry leaves.
Fry everything for a few minutes.
Add the carrot and turmeric powder. Fry for 5 minutes on a medium heat.
Finish with the coconut and a pinch of salt.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Carrot thoran
Description: A classic way of preparing vegetables in Kerala.

directions.Direction: For The Puttu
1. Mix red rice flour, salt, and water until slightly moist.
2. Rest the mixture for 15 minutes.
3. Layer coconut in a puttu steamer, add rice flour mixture, top with coconut.
4. Steam for 10-15 minutes.
For The Idli
1. Soak ingredients overnight, rinse.
2. Blend for a thick batter.
3. Ferment overnight; in a cold room, briefly heat and leave in the oven.
4. Add salt and water to batter. Optionally, add 1 tsp baking soda or Eno.
5. Steam in a greased idli steamer for 10-12 minutes.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Puttu and Idli
Description: Typical side recipes made from rice in Kerala

directions.Direction: Wash, peel and cut the potatoes into even sized pieces.
Add to a bowl with the onion, green chillies and curry leaves.
Add the chilli powder and turmeric power and salt. Mix well.
Heat some coconut oil in a pan and pop the mustard seeds. Add the hing.
Add the potato mixture and fry on a medium low heat stirring frequently.
The potatoes should take 10-12 minutes to cook. Once cooked but not too soft they are ready to serve.
Blend the coconut with the cumin and green chilli and set aside.
Wash and prep all your vegetables and cut into even size pieces.
Heat 2 tbsp of coconut oil in a pot and add the curry leaves.
If you are using onion fry for a few minutes.
Add the veg and fry on a medium low flame with the lid on for 10 minutes.
Add the coconut mixture and yogurt and fry for a couple more minutes.
Check for salt then serve.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Avial
Description: A classic vegetable stew made with coconut and yogurt

directions.Direction: In a pan, dry roast red chillies, peppercorns, coriander seeds and desiccated coconut. Add it to a blending jar. Next to the jar along with the contents add tamarind, jaggery, a pinch of salt, some water and blend it into a paste.
In a pan, heat oil, and add mustard, cumin and hing. Let pop for a couple of seconds. Next, add curry leaves and the paste and saute.
Meanwhile, in a separate vessel boil the sprouts. It will help remove the bitterness.
Once the oil starts leaving the paste, add the boiled sprouts and mix everything. Add some water to adjust consistency. And let simmer for a few minutes.
Your mooga gathi is now ready. Serve it with steamed rice or roti. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mooga gathi
Description: A rich coconut flavor with a hint of spice. This is a new comfort dish.

directions.Direction: In a blending jar, add soaked rice, poha, coconut, salt, sugar and water. Blend everything to a paste.
The paste needs to be thick yet flow consistency.
Heat a pan and grease it with some oil. Once the pan is hot enough, spread the batter.
Once the batter forms bubbles on the pan, add a teaspoon of oil and then flip.
Repeat the process with the remaining batter.
Your koiloreo is now ready. Serve it warm with coconut chutney or mooga gathi or a side of your choice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Koiloreo
Description: Full of flavors. These Goan pancakes are not just tasty but very light and healthy

directions.Direction: Chop the brinjal into cubes and season them with decent amont of salt, mix and let sit for one hour.
In a blending jar, add dried red chillies, garlic, ginger, fenugreek, cumin, vinegar and salt. Blend it into a paste.
Squeeze the water out from the brinjals, and deep fry them in some oil until they are soft and golden.
In another pan, heat some oil, Add roughly chopped garlic, curry leaves and the blended paste and mix until it leaves oil.
Next, add chilli powder, jaggery and fried brinjal. Mix everything.
The pickle is now ready. Store it in an airtight dry jar. Serve it with Koiloreo or steamed rice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Brinjal pickle
Description: Hands down, the best thing I have had.

directions.Direction: In a blending jar, add garlic, cinnamon, peppercorns, cloves, vinegar, turmeric, salt and kashmiri red chillies. Add a splash of water and blend everything to a thick paste.
Once the paste is ready, add it to paneer and give it a good mix and set it aside to marinate.
In a pan, heat some oil, add onions and cook them till they are golden. Next add the marinated paneer to the pan and cook until the oil separates.
Add some water to adjust the consistency of the curry and check for some salt.
Let simmer for a few minutes. Top it off with some coriander. Your vindaloo is now ready and can be served with steamed rice, koiloreo or side of your choice Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Paneer vindaloo
Description:
Bold spices, rich flavors,
simply delicious.

ingredients.Name: extra long grain basmati rice soaked

directions.Direction: In a pan, heat oil/ghee and add cassia leaf, cinnamon, peppercorns, cloves, cardamom pods and saute for a few seconds.
Next, add chopped onion and tomato cook for a few minutes and add salt and turmeric powder.
Next, add the rice, and saute for a few seconds. And then, add some water, bullion cube, and green peas.
Cook the rice for 10 minutes with the lid covered and do not stir in between.
Once done, place another pan on low heat and place the rice vessel with covered lid and let steam for 5-7 minutes.
Arroz is now ready and can be served with yogurt or mint chutney or a side of your choice. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Arroz
Description: A new go to comfort rice dish.

directions.Direction: Chop each drumstick into 3-4 pieces and boil it in water for 7-8 minutes.
In a mortar add ginger, garlic, green chillies, turmeric, coconut and cumin seeds. Pound everything with a splash of water and form a paste.
In a separate pan, heat some oil, add onions and fry until they are brownish golden. Next, proceed to adding the paste and saute. Next add salt to taste, tamarind water and sugar.
Cook everything till the oil separates and then add boiled drumsticks.
Simmer for 10 minutes with closed lid.
The drumstick sukke is now ready. Serve it with koiloreo or eat it alone. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Drumstick sukke
Description: A spice and coastal delight! A new way to eat drumsticks.

directions.Direction: First, add your peanuts, coconut, clove, cinnamon, and cardamom to a blender. To blend, add the amount of water indicated to the blender until the mixture is a fine paste.
Next, add your chopped white onion, curry leaves, and green chilli to a pan with your neutral oil. Saute these until they are soft.
After, add your ginger, garlic, and chopped tomatoes. Once this mixture is combined, add your peanut paste, turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
Once the above mixture bubbles and spits, add your boiled potatoes. Add some water to loosen up the consistency of the sauce.
When you are satisfied, add salt to taste and continue cooking the subji (sauce) for the next 15 mins on low to medium heat.
While it cooks, chop your coriander and mint leaves for garnish.
Serve with roti or rice to enjoy a classic dish.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo Kurma
Description: This recipe features a creamy and indulgent subji, one that pairs perfectly with rice or roti on an especially cold day of the year.

directions.Direction: First, cook either your moong dal or channa dal in a pot (the dal should hold shape, but mush easily if pressed between your fingers).
Add your dal to a large enough bowl with your rice flour, red onion, curry leaves, coriander leaves, sesame seeds, turmeric, red chilli powder, and salt to taste.
Next, add garlic, cumin seeds, and coriander seeds to a bowl or mortar and pestle. Pound the mixture until it is well combined but still coarse.
Add the above garlic mixture to your dal and rice flour mixture. Add water to the mixture and knead until a dough forms (it will crumble a little bit, but that's okay!).
Place a pan on your stove, and add your neutral oil before pressing some of the dough in the pan to cover the base.
Poke equidistant holes (about 5) with your finger and pour oils in the holes before covering the pan and letting the dough cook on medium heat for 10-20 mins.
Serve with yogurt, fresh green chillis, and slices of red onion.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Sarva pindi
Description: A delicious crunchy snack from Telangana served with cool yogurt. One of my favourite things to make when I seek comfort.

directions.Direction: First, for the Burani Raita, combine yogurt with grated garlic and red chili powder before adding chopped shallots, roasted cumin seeds (powdered), chopped mint leaves, and salt to taste. Set that aside and prepare your Biryani.
For the Biryani, we recommend prepping all your ingredients first.

Start by soaking your vegetables in water and cleaning them. Once ready, peel and chop your carrots and potatoes into even-sized pieces. Similarly, cut your beans, cauliflower leaves, and cauliflower (cut through the stalk to help cook quicker) into even-sized pieces.

Once cut, set your vegetables aside in a bowl. Next, chop your red onions into slices, grate your ginger and garlic into a paste, and slice your green chilies in half the long way after removing the stem.
Following this, chop your coriander leaves and set those aside before making your saffron milk. Pour boiling hot water over the saffron before adding in any milk of your choice.
Finally, crush your cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon.
Once this is ready, start by cooking your vegetables (to 70%) in some water, salt to taste, and turmeric. To stop the cooking process, soak the vegetables in cold water.
Once complete, cook your onions on low heat in some ghee or oil, slowly until they are fragrant. Once ready, increase the heat until the onions are browned. Drain the fat and set them aside.
Next, cook your rice in a pot of water with your whole spices (cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, cloves, and cumin seeds), salt to taste, and ginger garlic paste.
Wash your extra-long basmati rice in some cold water to remove the starch before adding the rice to the boiling water and spice mixture. Only boil this rice until it is 70% cooked.

Next, use the oil left over from the onions to temper the cumin seeds, broken cinnamon sticks, bay leaf, cardamom pods, and ginger garlic paste. Add 3/4 of the onions cooked earlier to the mixture before adding back in your vegetables, green peas, kala channa, and sliced green chilies.

To this mixture, add red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt to taste. Mix everything together on the stove and let that cook down so all the flavours are combined. Once combined, add your yogurt, fresh coriander, and lemon juice.
Next, you begin to layer your Biryani, slowly adding a single layer of drained 70% cooked rice to the pan with the vegetables (there should be more rice than vegetables in ratio).
Next, you begin to layer your Biryani, slowly adding a single layer of drained 70% cooked rice to the pan with the vegetables (there should be more rice than vegetables in ratio).

On top of the layered rice, add garam masala, ghee, saffron milk, and the rest of the crispy onions and chopped coriander. Next, top the layered rice with a paper towel splashed with water and cook for 8 mins on high heat with a lid. Once done, turn the heat down to low for 7 minutes. Finally, let the Biryani sit on the stove without any heat for 15 mins.
Open the lid and mix the Biryani. Plate this up with your Burani raita, fresh green chilies, sliced red onion, and lemon to enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Burani raita & Biryani
Description: The perfect spicy Biryani to serve for a feast. Paired with a delicious raita, this dish is one for the books.

directions.Direction: First, cut your green chilli pepper in half before frying your peppers until they are golden.

Set your peppers aside before dry roasting your peanuts, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, fenugreek, dried whole red chilli, and dried coconut. Once these are fragrant, in another pan, add oil and red onions, cooking until they are soft and brown around the edges.
Add your roasted spices, red onion, and the amount of water indicated to the blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth.
In another pan, add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ginger, and garlic. Give this a good mix before adding your turmeric and red chilli powder.
Pour your peanut mixture into the pan before adding in your tamarind paste, and additional water.
Next, add salt and sugar to the sauce; continue to cook the sauce down until it spits. Once ready, add your green chilli peppers back to the sauce with a little more water.
Continue to cook your sauce for 20 mins before adding chopped coriander. Serve with rice, fresh green chilli, and raw white onions.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mirchi ka salan
Description: With a hint of spice, Mirchi ka Salan is a treat on any day. Make this delicious peanut based curry that I love to eat with saffron rice.

directions.Direction: Wash the green beans and carrots. Peel and trim them then cut into small pieces.
Heat a pan with the oil and pop the mustard seeds.
Add the urid and chana dal and fry until slightly golden.
Add the ginger, dried red chilli and curry leaves. Fry for a few seconds.
Add the onion and fry for a couple minutes.
Add the beans and carrots then the turmeric and a pinch of salt.
Keep frying for about 2 minutes.
Add a splash of water and cook gently for 10-15 more minutes or until the carrots are cooked to your liking.
Finish with the coconut and ENJOY!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Bean and carrot poriyal
Description: A classic way of preparing vegetables in Tamil Nadu.

directions.Direction: Toast the rice and moong dal for a few minutes in a dry pan then wash a couple times in cold water.
Heat a pot and add 1 tbsp of ghee. Then add the hing, ginger and green chillies.
Add the washed dal and rice and cover with water. Add a pinch of salt and cook until the rice and dal is very over cooked. Keep adding water as needed.
Once the rice and dal is mushy let it relax off the heat with the lid on.
For the final temper:
Heat a small pot and add 2 tbsp of ghee. Then add the cashews, cumin seeds, black pepper and curry leaves. Fry until the cashews are golden.
Pour the temper over the rice and dal. Mix well and check if more salt is needed then serve.
Soak all the dal and rice over night. Rinse well then transfer to a blender with the cumin, fenugreek, dried chilli, garlic and ginger.
Blend with water to form a thick batter.
You don’t need to ferment the batter but some leave to ferment for a couple hours.
Add the chopped onion and curry leaves. Add the turmeric and pinch of salt.
Add more water if needed to loosen.
Cook in a pan like a dosa or pancake.
Cook on one side on a medium low flame then add oil then flip and cook on a high heat.
In a bowl mix the yogurt with water and salt to form a runny consistency.
Blend the toor dal, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds with a little water to form a paste.
Add this paste to the yogurt and mix well.
In a pot heat some oil and pop the mustard and fenugreek seeds.
Add the dried red chilli and onion then fry for a few minutes.
Add the hing, turmeric and curry leaves and fry for a few more seconds.
Add the yogurt mixture and bring to the boil.
Check if it needs more salt then serve.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mor kulambu
Description: A spicy yogurt gravy.

ingredients.Name: shallots, chopped or baby shallots peeled

directions.Direction: Cut the potato, carrot, green beans, drumstick and aubergine into even size pieces.
Soak the toor dal and rice overnight then rinse really well.
Cook in a pressure cooker or boil until soft with water and turmeric powder. Once cooked mash up with a whisk or potato masher.
Then make the masala powder by toasting all the ingredients until golden and grind into a powder. Set aside.
Heat a large pot and add 2 tbsp oil then add the mustard seeds and hing.
Then add the shallot and curry leaves and fry for a few minutes.
Add the tomato and the vegetables. Add a pinch of salt and 2-3 tbsp of the masala powder. Fry for a minute or so.
Cover with water then add the green peas and tamarind water.
Add the dal/rice and some more water and let it cook down for 10-15 minutes. Check if more salt is needed.
For the final temper heat the ghee in a small pot then add the cashews and peanuts. Let them turn slightly golden.
Add the dried chili and curry leaves and coconut. Fry for a minute or so then pour the hot temper over the pot of dal.
Let it sit for 10 minutes before serving.
In a bowl add the yogurt, flour and enough water to make a stretchy spoonable batter.
Mix well then add the curry leaves, green chilli, coriander and coconut. Season with salt.
Mix well then spoon into hot oil and fry on both sides until golden brown.
Drain on a paper towel and enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Mysore bonda
Description: Fritters flavoured with coconut and curry leaves

directions.Direction: Heat 2-3 tbsp of oil in a pan and once hot temper the mustards seeds.
Add the hing and then the chana dal. Let it turn slightly golden brown.
Add the peanuts, onion and green chilli. Fry gently for 3-4 minutes.
Add the curry leaves, turmeric, coriander leaves and a pinch of salt.
Add the lime or lemon juice then the cooked rice.
Stir well and fry for a few more minutes to dry out the mixture a little.
Check to see if any more salt is needed then serve.
Grind roasted chana into a fine powder; set aside.
Soak tamarind in boiling water for 10-15 minutes.
Heat 2-3 tbsp oil in a pan; temper mustard and cumin seeds.
Briefly fry green chili and onions.
Add turmeric, curry leaves, and jaggery; continue cooking.
Pour in strained tamarind water; bring to a boil.
Mix in 2 tbsp roasted chana powder; let the paste cool.

In a large bowl, combine puffed rice, tomato, and onion. Add the cooled masala paste, a pinch of salt, and gradually mix in roasted chana powder until well combined. Transfer to a plate, garnish with tomato, onion, coriander, and sev. Enjoy!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Girmit
Description: A delicious street food snack made with puffed rice

directions.Direction: Toast the toor dal, coriander seeds and dried chilli in a dry pan. Once toasted add a little oil and fry for another minute.

Soak the tamarind in boiling water. Leave to sit for 10-15 minutes then strain.
Heat a pot of water and add the tamarind and jaggery.
Then add the masala and boil for 10 minutes.
Head a small pan and add the ghee. Temper the mustard seeds, cumin seeds and hing. You can also add the curry leaves now too.
Pour the temper into the pot of masala and finish with fresh coriander and a pinch of salt.

directions.Direction: Mix yogurt with ginger, green chili, and a pinch of salt.

Add turmeric powder and fry for a few seconds.
Pour in the yogurt mixture and bring it to a boil.

Finish with a pinch of salt and fresh coriander.

Thumb sized piece of ginger, chopped

directions.Direction: Soak moong dal and rice overnight, then rinse thoroughly.
Blend the soaked moong dal and rice with ginger, green chili, salt, and water to form a batter.
Adjust the batter's consistency by adding more water if necessary.
Spoon the batter onto a hot non-stick pan, spreading it into a flat pancake or a crepe shape.
Cook until one side becomes crisp, then drizzle with oil, sprinkle chopped onion, and fold in half before removing from the pan.
Heat a saucepan with 1 tbsp of oil, then fry dried chili, moong dal, and chana dal.

Add spices to the mashed potato and season with salt.
Take the seeds out the peppers and stuff with the potato mixture.
Strain the besan through a civ to remove lumps and mix with the chilli powder, turmeric and salt.
Slow add water to form a slightly thick batter.
Dip the peppers in the batter and fry in hot oil until golden on both sides.
Drain on a paper towel and serve.
Strain the besan into a bowl to remove any lumps.

Slowly add water to form into a dough.
Roll the dough into long pieces and boil in salted boiling water for 7-10 minutes.
Cut them with a scissors into small dumpling shapes and set them aside for later.
In a pot heat some oil or ghee and temper the cumin and fennel seeds.
Add the dried chili, bay leaf, hing and ginger. Fry for a few seconds.
Add the onion and fry gently for a few minutes.
Mix the yogurt with the chili and turmeric powder then add to the pot.

Heat the jaggery with the 3 cups of water and let it melt. Pour into the pan with the wheat.

Name: Lapsi
Description: Rich and sweet dessert popular in Rajasthan.

directions.Direction: Rinse black urad dal and cook until easily mashable.

Add blended tomatoes with watery consistency, stir until well combined, and oil separates.
Introduce coriander powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, and fenugreek; cook until it sputters.
Add cooked urad dal to the pan, stir well.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Maa Ki Dal
Description: A creamy unctuous dish made for a cold but cozy evening. A single bite of this daal floods back memories of childhood.

directions.Direction: First, steam or boil your potatoes before peeling and mashing them into a smooth consistency.
To your potatoes, add ajwain seeds, cumin powder, red chilli powder, anardana powder, coriander seeds, dried fenugreek, fresh coriander, chopped garlic, chopped ginger, and chopped green chilli.
Mix the potato and the spices well before setting the mixture aside to start on the outer dough.
The dough: Begin by adding your wheat flour and salt to a deep bowl. Keep adding water until a dough forms then, kneading with your hands.
Knead for about 5-6 minutes before coating your dough in oil and placing it back in the bowl for 30 mins to rest.
Once done, break your dough into 4 pieces and begin to flatten one of the balls to fill it with stuffing.
When the dough is filled, flour your surface and roll the dough out into a circular shape. The dough should be 1/6 of an inch thick.
Following this, heat a pan until it is hot and place your paratha on the stove cooking on one side before adding ghee once flipped.
Once your paratha is ready, plate it with an extra bit of butter, some pickle, yogurt, or other savouries!

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Aloo Paratha

Plate rajma with white basmati rice, sliced red onions, and green chilies.

Name: Rajma Chawal

15. Season well with salt and serve with more ghee or butter on top.
Heat some oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them pop.
Add the hing, dried chilli, curry leaves and ginger. Fry for a few seconds then add the onion and green chilli.

Add the turmeric, chilli powder and garam masala. Let the spices cook out for a minute.

Mix everything well and fry for a few more minutes before finishing with fresh coriander.
Wash the Methi leaves and chop them quite fine. Chop or pound the green chilli and add to the leaves in a bowl.
Add the yogurt and the rest of the ingredients to form a dough.
Form the dough into small ball shapes and roll them out into roti shapes.

Flip one more time and transfer to a plate and allow to cool.

Description: Popular flatbread typical in Gujarat.

Add 2 chopped tomatoes and the minced ginger.
Add the chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Fry for a minute.
Add the jaggery and boiled peanuts.
Add the dal and season well with salt. Add more water if needed.

Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and ghee.
Strain the besan through a civ into a bowl to remove any lumps.
Add citric acid, salt, sugar, turmeric, ginger, chilli then add water slowly and whisk until it resembles the consistency in my video.

Name: Gujarati kadhi
Description: A sweet and tangy yogurt dish.

Creator: plantfuture
Name: Methi na gota
Description: Light and crispy fritters made with methi leaves and besan.

Name: Handvo
Description: A delicious savoury cake made with lentils and a temper of spices.
